20 
21 #include "tbb/concurrent_hash_map.h"
22 
23 namespace tbb {
24 
25 namespace internal {
26 #if !TBB_NO_LEGACY
27 struct hash_map_segment_base {
28  typedef spin_rw_mutex segment_mutex_t;
30  typedef size_t hashcode_t;
32  static const size_t n_segment_bits = 6;
34  static const size_t max_physical_size = size_t(1)<<(8*sizeof(hashcode_t)-n_segment_bits);
36  segment_mutex_t my_mutex;
37  // Number of nodes
38  atomic<size_t> my_logical_size;
39  // Size of chains
41  size_t my_physical_size;
43 
44  bool __TBB_EXPORTED_METHOD internal_grow_predicate() const;
45 };
46 
47 bool hash_map_segment_base::internal_grow_predicate() const {
48  // Intel(R) Thread Checker considers the following reads to be races, so we hide them in the
49  // library so that Intel(R) Thread Checker will ignore them. The reads are used in a double-check
50  // context, so the program is nonetheless correct despite the race.
51  return my_logical_size >= my_physical_size && my_physical_size < max_physical_size;
52 }
53 #endif
54 
55 } // namespace internal
56 
57 } // namespace tbb
